title: Level 6 Measurement Practice Test
description: Test your skills with area of parallelograms and triangles, volume of rectangular prisms, and time conversions.

questions.question: What is the area of a parallelogram with base $9\text{ cm}$ and perpendicular height $6\text{ cm}$?
questions.explanation: Area of a parallelogram $= b \times h = 9 \times 6 = 54\text{ cm}^2$.

questions.question: What is the area of a triangle with base $14\text{ m}$ and height $8\text{ m}$?
questions.explanation: Area of a triangle $= \frac{1}{2} \times b \times h = \frac{1}{2} \times 14 \times 8 = 56\text{ m}^2$.

questions.question: A rectangular prism has dimensions $5\text{ cm} \times 4\text{ cm} \times 10\text{ cm}$. What is its volume?
What is $3{:}45\text{ pm}$ in 24-hour time?
questions.explanation: For pm times, add $12$ to the hours: $3 + 12 = 15$. So $3{:}45\text{ pm} = 15{:}45$.

questions.question: A train departs at $09{:}20$ and arrives at $11{:}05$. How long is the journey?
questions.explanation: From $09{:}20$ to $11{:}05$: from $09{:}20$ to $10{:}00$ is $40$ minutes, from $10{:}00$ to $11{:}00$ is $60$ minutes, from $11{:}00$ to $11{:}05$ is $5$ minutes. Total: $40 + 60 + 5 = 105$ minutes $= 1$ hour $45$ minutes.

questions.question: A triangle has an area of $36\text{ cm}^2$ and a base of $12\text{ cm}$. What is the perpendicular height?
questions.explanation: $A = \frac{1}{2} \times b \times h$, so $36 = \frac{1}{2} \times 12 \times h$, giving $36 = 6h$, so $h = 6\text{ cm}$.

questions.question: Find the area of a parallelogram with base $15\text{ cm}$ and perpendicular height $7\text{ cm}$. Give your answer in $\text{cm}^2$.
A fish tank is $60\text{ cm}$ long, $30\text{ cm}$ wide, and $40\text{ cm}$ tall. What is its volume in $\text{cm}^3$?
Convert $20{:}15$ to 12-hour time.
questions.explanation: Since $20 \geq 13$, subtract $12$: $20 - 12 = 8$. It's after noon, so $20{:}15 = 8{:}15\text{ pm}$.

questions.question: A composite shape is made of a rectangle ($10\text{ m} \times 6\text{ m}$) with a triangle on top (base $10\text{ m}$, height $4\text{ m}$). What is the total area in $\text{m}^2$?
questions.explanation: Rectangle area $= 10 \times 6 = 60\text{ m}^2$. Triangle area $= \frac{1}{2} \times 10 \times 4 = 20\text{ m}^2$. Total $= 60 + 20 = 80\text{ m}^2$.
